intro: Rubus hirtus proles pierratii, commonly known as the Pierratii raspberry, is a shrub native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It is characterized by its prickly stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically red when ripe, containing multiple drupes. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value and edible fruits, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and agroforestry systems.
